byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and AMINA ISMAIL

abstract: Egyptian authorities raid independent publishing house Merit and shut down respected Townhouse Gallery in Cairo; free-speech advocates say actions are part of expanding crackdown on political dissent.
lead_paragraph: The Egyptian authorities have shut down a pioneering art gallery and raided an independent publishing house in what activists say is a move to muffle dissent ahead of the January 25 anniversary of 2011 uprising.

headline.main: Egypt Shuts Arts Venues Amid Signs of Clampdown
headline.print_headline: Egypt Shuts Arts Venues Amid Signs of Clampdown

snippet: The Egyptian authorities have shut down a pioneering art gallery and raided an independent publishing house in what activists say is a move to muffle dissent ahead of the January 25 anniversary of 2011 uprising.
